reviews.title: Heaven IS a place on earth.

reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple

The breakfast options are wonderful and the cooked breakfast was cooked to perfection. Would absolutely recommend for a fantastic stay in the lake district.
reviews.title: Good Spot
Beck Allans
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights mid week. It is well situated in a lovely spot alongside the local river, very centrally in the village and we were unaffected by traffic noise or noise from other guest rooms. The hosts Ian and Christine are very friendly, helpful and knowledgeable of the locality - thanks Ian we found Tarn Hows. The room was clean, well furnished, the bed comfortable and the bathroom was spacious and well equipped. Car parking in the grounds was not a problem. This is only a guest house and there is no guests lounge but it is ideal for a very comfortable stay if you only want B & B. The breakfast was more than adequate and freshly cooked and with plenty of tea/coffee refills. Here perhaps was the only downside that we could comment on in that breakfast is only served between 08.30 and 09.00; although that wasnt a problem to us. If revisiting the area would we stay here again? - yes, most definately.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for two nights early June . It was our first stay because it was always booked up in the past and I can see why. Ian and Christine were lovely hosts,very friendly and helpful.The room we had was very good, spacious enough with a beautiful newly fitted bathroom (cant remember the room number), was on the second floor with views of the gardens. The breakfasts were delicious and plentiful and the early time frame was not a problem at all. Lovely b&b, and will definately return....if we can book early enough!
reviews.title: Lovely B & B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You will not find a better B&B anywhere in the Lakes. We have stayed several times over 4 years and it just gets better. Christine & Ian are perfect hosts nothing is too much trouble, you are alway's made to feel very welcome we never want to leave..
reviews.title: The best B&B ever.

reviews.text: All the rooms stunning, we like a river view but would happily stay in any. The B&B has a perfect location in the heart of the village, next to the river Rothay, just stunning.
reviews.title: Perfection!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ian's breakfasts are to die for really tasty, just what you need to start the day.
reviews.title: Short break in the heart of Grasmere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Definatley the best place to stay in the Lakes, no complaints about anything at all. We'll certainly be back again & again.
reviews.title: Peaceful, pretty, perfect :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our 3rd visit to this lovely b & b in Grasmere.It is ideally situated in the heart of the village, yet it is so quite & peacefull. Ian & Christine are great hosts, nothing is any bother to them. The breakfast are something else! All the rooms are lovely, clean & fresh. Very comfy beds. It really feels like we're visiting old friends when we get there!
reviews.title: Like visiting old friends.
Just as good as ever!
reviews.text: Got to be one of the very best bed and breakfasts in Cumbria. Great location, great breakfasts, great attention to detail from Ian and Christine - all adds up to a top break. Always looks fresh and the rooms are really clean and comfortable. We'll be back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the heart of the Lake District, Grasmere is a convenient and wonderful village to use as a base for exploration and walking & hiking trips around the area. And, in the heart of the village, is a wonderful Bed and Breakfast run by two very charming people. Ian and Christine are perfect hosts, full of information and happy to give directions and make recommendations. The rooms are immaculate; the breakfasts are delicious. I can't imagine why anyone wouldn't want to stay in this wonderful house. I have been very comfortable staying there, now several years in a row. As I mentioned the rooms are clean and well appointed, there is lots of hot water, the beds are comfortable , and very quiet. I so enjoy staying there!
reviews.title: Excellent experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ian and Christine are perfect hosts. This review is very late as we last visited for a second time in June 2011 I had to put Aug for the review. The house is situated at the heart of the village (well it feels like it anyway) and the room we had is very comfortable and peaceful, overlooking the garden and the beck which bubbles along. I love the near tame ducks that hang out at the entrance to the house.
reviews.title: A great little B&B in a perfect English village

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfasts are excellent and the B&B provides excellent value for money.
reviews.title: Delightful B&B!

reviews.text: Christine and Ian run a perfect guest house, from the cup of tea and homemade biscuits on arrival, immaculate rooms and a delicious and attentive breakfast. Its a convenient and quiet location in the heart of Grasmere. Deserving of their Trip Advisor Excellence Award.
reviews.title: Perfect hospitality, perfect location

reviews.text: We had a fabulous weekend at the BeckAllen guest house. This was a treat from our daughter and son in law, and what a treat it was. Ian and Christine were very accommodating and the breakfast was delicious. We would definitely stay there again if we were in the area.
reviews.title: Lovely relaxing weekend!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our fifth or sixth visit to Beck Allans and we always have a very enjoyable and relaxing stay. Right in the centre of Grasmere, it is a quiet guest house with a lovely river running beside it. Good choice of tasty breakfasts. Very good rooms and very comfortable beds. Very friendly and helpful hosts.
reviews.title: Great B&B

reviews.text: Stayed for two nights. Very friendly welcome. Very good rooms. Fantastic breakfast. Wonderful location right in the heart of Grasmere. Great walking and dining options on the doorstep. Will certainly return.
reviews.title: Truly excellent B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Whilst it might lack some of the amenities of Ambleside or Keswick, Grasmere is very much the spiritual heart of the Lakes, with its Wordsworth connections, its ancient church, the magical lake, and located as it is in a natural amphitheatre of hills. You can easily spend a week here and never feel the need to use the car, or to travel further than your legs can carry you. If you do, then there is nowhere better for you to stay than here at this wonderful B&B, which is located right on the pulse of life in the centre of the village! Ian and Christine are the perfect hosts: welcoming, attentive, friendly but never intrusive. Why have we returned at least five times now? For my wife, it is the immaculate condition of the rooms, spotlessly clean, subject to a continuous programme of renovation and improvement, and with the most comfortable of beds. For me, I tend to think with my stomach - the breakfasts are to die for, with an infinite variety of delights cooked by Ian, or the cold collation and the nectaresque smoothies prepared by Christine! Having tried many other B&Bs in both Grasmere and the rest of the Lake District, I can say this is one of the very, very best.
reviews.title: Jewel in the crown of Lakeland B&Bs

aka: Beck Allans Guest House Hotel Grasmere
description: A traditionally built, Lakeland house which is concealed in the grounds and quietly situated adjacent to and overlooking the River Rothay. We are located in the centre of Grasmere village, in the Heart of the English Lake District, 4 miles from Ambleside, 8 miles from Windermere and 12 miles from Keswick. It certainly provides a high degree of comfort being double glazed, centrally heated, tastefully decorated and well furnished accommodation throughout. Our superior rooms contain king sized beds, one has a Super King size or Twin bed.
